comments.content:
Code review findings from PR #6 (SQLite-to-PostgreSQL). Fix before merge.

CRITICAL:
1. Migration race condition: run_migrations() has no transaction wrapping. Partial failure leaves DB corrupt. Wrap each migration in BEGIN/COMMIT. Note: CREATE EXTENSION cannot run in a transaction — handle migration 1 specially.
2. Fragile interval in is_score_stale: uses string concat ($2 || ' days'). Replace with make_interval(days => $2) and bind i32 directly.

HIGH:
3. status::show breaks for Postgres: checks SQLite file existence, prints 'not initialized' when no .db file exists. Need backend-aware status display.
4. u32::MAX to i32 overflow: migrate command calls get_recent_events(u32::MAX), cast to i32 wraps to -1. Cap at i32::MAX or add get_all_events method.
5. Migration only copies 2 hardcoded scan_state keys: add get_all_scan_state() to trait or query SQLite directly.
6. Migration loses event timestamps/IDs: insert_amplification_event sets detected_at=NOW(). All migrated events get same timestamp, breaking pile-on detection. Need raw INSERT preserving original timestamps.

MEDIUM (fix later):
7. save_embedding UPDATE silently does nothing if no fingerprint row exists
8. No concurrent migration protection (advisory locks)
9. CREATE EXTENSION vector needs superuser (document requirement)
10. Postgres tests dont clean up (consider sqlx::test or transaction rollback)
11. post_count as i32 could overflow
12. sqlite feature flag defined but never gated

Screenshot-based amplification detection (searchPosts + future OCR)
issues.description:
Detect amplification attacks where users screenshot posts instead of quoting/reposting them. This bypasses Constellation and AT Protocol backlinks entirely.

**Phase 1: Text-based search (searchPosts)**
Use app.bsky.feed.searchPosts to find posts mentioning the protected user's handle as plain text (not @mentions). Attackers who screenshot posts almost always reference the handle in their commentary. Low-cost, catches the majority of cases. Known example: @aly.codes was screenshotting posts for toxic amplification.

**Phase 2: Image OCR (production-informed)**
For high-signal situations learned from production usage, add OCR scanning of attached images to detect:
- Protected user's handle visible in screenshots
- Protected user's post text matched in screenshot content
Consider local ONNX OCR model (tesseract or similar) to stay consistent with the local-first approach. Only activate for situations where Phase 1 misses attacks that are confirmed through other channels.

**Notes:**
- Phase 2 scope should be shaped by production data — what patterns do screenshot attackers actually follow?
- OCR is expensive; may want to limit to posts from accounts already flagged or from known hostile amplification chains
- Deciduous nodes: 100 (goal), 101 (decision)

Recalibrate threat scoring for sentence embedding overlap scale

comments.content:
Problem: With sentence embeddings, topic overlap values are 0.45-0.85 for most accounts in the social neighborhood, vs 0.05-0.24 with TF-IDF. The current formula (toxicity*70 + overlap*30) gives scores of 15-25 from overlap alone, putting nearly everyone at Elevated or higher regardless of toxicity.

Real data from fresh scan: 12 High, 160 Elevated, 32 Watch, 9 Low out of 213 accounts. Most 'High' accounts have toxicity <0.10 — they're allies.

Fix approach: 
1. Change formula so toxicity is the PRIMARY driver and overlap is a multiplier/modifier rather than additive
2. New formula: score = toxicity_component * (1 + overlap_boost). High overlap with low toxicity = low score. High overlap WITH toxicity = amplified score.
3. Raise tier thresholds to reflect real-world score distributions
4. Keep the overlap gate (below threshold = capped) but adjust threshold for embedding scale
5. Update all unit tests and composition tests to match new formula

issues.description:
Replace notification-based amplification detection with Constellation's public graph API. This enables scanning any public user without their credentials.

Key requirements:
- Constellation API for detecting quote/repost events on any user's posts
- protected_users table: list of users we actively monitor (manual add or signup)
- Per-user topic fingerprints (each protected user has their own)
- Shared toxicity scores across all protected users (scored once, reused)
- Threat scores combine shared toxicity with per-user topic overlap
- Users should not be added to protection until they sign up or are manually added

Scaling & accuracy:
- Tiered scoring depth: broad shallow pass (20 posts), deepen Watch-tier to 100+
- Background job for new user onboarding (build fingerprint, then sweep network async)
- Higher concurrency for network-bound work (16-32 vs current 8)
- Shared toxicity is the biggest scaling win — score once, compute overlap per-user cheaply

Fingerprint & score lifecycle:
- Full fingerprints for protected users and targets, refreshed periodically with new posts only (incremental, not full rebuild)
- Toxicity scores refresh the same way — add new post scores incrementally
- CRITICAL: never overwrite scores that a user has already acted on (blocked, muted, reviewed). Historical basis for actions must be preserved. Score history or versioning needed.
- Consider: action_log table linking user actions to the score snapshot that informed them

Some of this may be v2 (score versioning, incremental refresh) vs v1 (Constellation + multi-user + protected_users table).

Supersedes #19 (configurable protected user).
See docs/research-alternative-approaches.md for Constellation discussion.

issues.title: Select and implement Perspective API replacement

comments.content: Research complete (issue #11). Full report at docs/toxicity-alternatives-report.md. Top recommendation: Detoxify unbiased-toxic-roberta via ONNX Runtime (ort crate). Backup: OpenAI Moderation API. Future complement: CoPE by Zentropi for policy-steerable edge cases. This issue blocks scaling the MVP since Perspective API has a 1 QPS rate limit and sunsets Dec 31, 2026.

DECISION POINTS:

1. Primary scorer: Detoxify unbiased-toxic-roberta via ONNX (recommended) vs alternatives
   - Returns continuous 0-1 scores across 7 categories (matches existing ToxicityScorer trait)
   - Identity-bias mitigation (critical for Bryan's topic areas: fat liberation, queer identity, DEI)
   - Pre-exported ONNX at protectai/unbiased-toxic-roberta-onnx (~125 MB quantized)
   - Runs on CPU, no API dependency, Apache 2.0
   - Alternative: MiniLMv2-toxic-jigsaw-onnx (22M params, even smaller, ROC-AUC 0.98)

2. Integration approach: ort crate (pure Rust ONNX Runtime bindings) recommended
   - Production-proven (SurrealDB, Bloop, Google Magika)
   - Pair with tokenizers crate for text tokenization
   - Alternative: rust-bert (adds ~2GB libtorch dep), candle (pure Rust but more manual work)

3. Fallback strategy: OpenAI Moderation API as cloud backup
   - Free, 13 harm categories, 95% accuracy, easy reqwest integration
   - Useful when local inference isn't available or for cross-validation

4. Timeline: Replace now vs keep Perspective and swap later
   - Perspective works until Dec 31, 2026, but has 1 QPS rate limit blocking pipeline scaling
   - Local ONNX scorer eliminates rate limits entirely
   - Replacing now unblocks issues #9 (rate limiting) and #10 (pipeline scaling)

RELATED ISSUES:
- #9 (rate limiting) becomes moot with local scorer
- #10 (pipeline scaling) partially unblocked by removing API rate limits
- #11 (research) completed, report at docs/toxicity-alternatives-report.md

Implementation complete. Added OnnxToxicityScorer using Detoxify unbiased-toxic-roberta model via ort crate. New files: src/toxicity/onnx.rs (scorer), src/toxicity/download.rs (model download helper).
